ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I practiced discussing and analyzing a variety of films.
This course strengthened my ability to analyze films audiovisually and analyses their sequences.
Learned so much about film and film analysis and close looking.
This class goes really in depth into film theory and modes of thinking about movies.
I have developed my film literacy, participation confidence, and depth of analysis in this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Oksana is a great professor and picked interesting films to watch

Weaknesses: Class engagement in discussion is very low

This course is very good at showing what good close analysis looks like and the films we watch for the course are very interesting. The 2 hour class time is a bit long, especially to spend the entire time analyzing one film.
I don't have any suggestions for improvements!

Definitely an amazing class to take if you are curious about film and philosophical interpretations of the art form; the class is pretty long however and the topics are highly conceptual, which can make it hard to follow if you're not completely engaged.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a good intro course for those interested in film.
I would not recommend this course, but I would say its fine and good for the film majors for whom this course is a requirement.
Yes! Anyone interested in film especially.
YES! 11/10 would recommend it. Great professor, beautiful selection of films and articles, interesting discussion, and a lot of opportunities to reflect and learn.
I would definitely recommend if you are a film major and/or are interested in film theory and writing about film. This teaches you a lot of key concepts in film theory.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student.
